items.title: Can V2 Retail sustain its growth in value fashion?
items.description: Aggressive store additions, expanding margins, and improving return ratios underpin growth visibility

items.title: Krsnaa Diagnostics: Chasing new avenues for growth
items.description: Optimistic guidance for FY26; the B2C segment should act as a key growth lever

items.title: Coal India's renewable plan looks at a future beyond coal
items.description: The state-owned company sought expressions of interest for the construction of 3 gigawatts of solar and 2 gigawatts of wind projects

items.title: Hotel chains expect lower GST to boost income, revenue
items.description: Hoteliers expect a 5–7 percent higher occupancy in leisure markets and a 3–5 percent in business hubs if the GST is lowered for the Rs 7,500-room segment

items.title: Improving India–China ties unlikely to bring immediate relief to Huawei and ZTE
items.description: While India banned several Chinese apps in 2020, Huawei and ZTE were never formally prohibited. Instead, New Delhi tightened security norms through a directive for the telecom sector, which has been in place since June 2021.

items.title: Sula Vineyards banks on premium wines, tourism to fuel growth beyond metros
items.description: The strategy of premiumisation alongside booming wine tourism and innovations like the Muscat Blanc is helping transform wine into an aspirational lifestyle choice across Tier 2 and 3 cities, CEO Rajeev Samant tells Moneycontrol

items.title: Krsnaa Diagnostics: Chasing new avenues for growth
items.description: Optimistic guidance for FY26; the B2C segment should act as a key growth lever

items.title: Can V2 Retail sustain its growth in value fashion?
items.description: Aggressive store additions, expanding margins, and improving return ratios underpin growth visibility

items.title: Indus Towers gets board nod to foray into African market
items.description: Entry in to African market will mark the first-ever overseas expansion of Indus Towers

items.title: NCLAT declines to stay HNG resolution proceedings
items.description: The resolution plan has been contested by AGI Greenpac Ltd, erstwhile promoter Mukul Somany, dissenting financial creditor Exclusive Capital Ltd and operational creditor Soneko

items.title: JSW Cement posts wider quarterly loss on one-off charge
items.description: Consolidated net loss for the April-June quarter came in at Rs 1,356 crore, compared with a loss of Rs 15,120 crore a year ago

items.title: JLR hit by cyber incident that disrupts production, sales
items.description: The company, owned by India's Tata Motors, said it had not found any evidence at this stage that any customer data had been stolen after it shut down its systems to mitigate impact

items.title: Kraft Heinz to separate into two publicly traded companies
items.description: The announcement unwinds a $46 billion merger a decade ago that united two iconic brands.

items.title: ASML pitches for India business as PM Modi eyes local chip making
items.description: The Veldhoven, Netherlands-based company wants to deepen its collaboration with Indian companies in the year ahead

items.title: Indian shrimp exporters see relief from US holiday demand
items.description: Exporters see that some consumers in the US are open to absorb full 50 percent tariff costs to cater to the upcoming holiday season, intending to pass on the costs to end consumers

items.title: Essar Steel insolvency in focus as acquisition by ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India questioned before NCLT
items.description: If allegations regarding stamp duty are upheld, potential liabilities for ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India could run into thousands of crores, factoring in both duty and penalties.

items.title: Thangamayil Jewellery: Can this stock add shine to the investor portfolio?
items.description: Backed by fresh funds infusion via a rights issue as well as strong cash flow generation, TMJL has accelerated new store openings.

items.title: Why does this IT service growth leader merit attention?
items.description: Industry-leading earnings growth and the AI edge should help the stock do well

items.title: August auto sales hit GST speed breaker
items.description: The outlook is good on the back of a possible policy push and better monsoon this year

items.title: Samsung boosts retail muscle but says festive smartphone sales may remain flat despite strong monsoon
items.description: Samsung, however, expects strong volume growth in tier-3, tier-4, and rural markets, while the overall market will see value growth as consumers upgrade to premium devices.

items.title: IndusInd Bank appoints Pragati Gondhalekar as head of internal audit, days after Rajiv Anand takes over as CEO
items.description: The lender has faced a series of exits at senior level since April this year, including CEO Sumant Kathpalia, after discrepancies in derivatives accounting and MFI books were reported.

items.title: AB Capital appoints Vishakha Mulye as the MD and CEO for five years
items.description: Vishakha has been credited for envisioning the ‘One ABC, One P&L’ strategy which has been central to Aditya Birla Capital’s transformative journey.

items.title: Puravankara eyes Rs 2,700 crore potential revenue from Malabar Hill redevelopment project
items.description: It will provide new and premium homes for existing residents while also creating a substantial portion for sale.

items.title: Deutsche Bank puts India retail banking business up for sale: Report
items.description: The Germany-based bank has pledged to make its retail business more profitable

items.title: Bankruptcy-bound Supertech gives possession of 6k flats in last 3 years; 15k buyers still stuck
items.description: There are still around 15,000 flats undelivered in these 16 projects across Noida, Greater Noida and Meerut.

items.title: Reliance is building a mega solar park in India to fuel its new energy plans
items.description: In Kutch, RIL also plans to build facilities for production of green ammonia, green methanol, and sustainable aviation fuel.

items.title: Furniture giant IKEA assembles small town strategy to double B2B business by 2028
items.description: IKEA doesn’t plan to set up stores in every city right away. Instead, it is placing key account managers in these markets to work closely with builders, architects, and customers, ensuring the brand stays visible and relevant well before a physical store comes up.
